docs.text: libby parsons ( ashley judd ) is a happily married mom leading a normal life .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: one night , her husband nick ( bruce greenwood ) takes her out for a romantic escape on a sailboat .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: libby awakens in the middle of the night to find she is covered in blood and nick has strangely disappeared .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: she follows a trail of bloody footprints up to the deck , where she handles a fallen knife ( like any stupid character ) and is spotted by the coast guard , who are responding to a distress signal sent earlier in the evening .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: nick is presumed dead , and although she pleads her innocence , libby is tried and convicted for the murder of her husband .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: now , please don't think i'm spoiling any vital plot details , because the informative trailer has already spilled most of the beans .

docs.text: if you haven't seen this preview , don't read any further .

docs.text: but seriously , the inane screenplay by douglas weisberg and douglas s . cook is so elementary that the average viewer will be two or three steps ahead of the characters .

docs.text: during the most vital scenes in the movie , i was anticipating every twist or `surprise' that eventually popped up on the screen .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i imagine the writers presume their core audience for double jeopardy is a very naive group of individuals .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: most , unfortunately , will be too distracted by the moronic plot to appreciate the few positive aspects of the production .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: one is tommy lee jones , who plays travis lehman , a parole officer given the tedious task of watching over libby after she serves her sentence in prison .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: jones is always wonderful as an authority figure , and he's certainly familiar with this sort of role ( as he played so well in the fugitive and us marshals ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: judd , as a likable heroin with gusto , also has a chance to flex her acting abilities .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: while emotionally unconvincing , the actress is tremendously fun in her juvenile role , perking up the movie like an injection of anti-depressant .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the actors , and their relationship together , present the one-two punch that prevents double jeopardy from derailing itself entirely .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and now , back to the plot .

docs.text: while behind bars , libby learns an interesting little bit of information : a person can't be convicted of the same crime twice .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this law , called `double jeopardy' , could be her motive for hunting down her husband . . .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: who may still be alive .
